author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves blocking external communication on specific ports that are identified as malicious or suspicious. It is a proactive measure to prevent unauthorized access and mitigate potential threats from external sources. This capability can be implemented through firewall rules, intrusion prevention systems, or other network security tools to ensure that traffic on these ports is denied.

requirements.description: Authority and access permissions to implement containment measures.
Technical capability and tools to execute containment actions effectively.
Procedures to validate containment effectiveness and monitor for bypass attempts.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: Block Port External Communication

references.name: Network Segmentation and Port Blocking Strategies
NIST SP 800-41 Rev. 1: Guidelines for Firewall and Network Security
CISA Ransomware Guide - Network Security Controls
